contest-event.event-date:
Dec. 25, 1920 D Scottish Championship (Third Section)
Scottish Championship (Third Section) 30 Test Piece Contest Scottish Championship scottish-championship-third-section National Championship of Great Britain (Third Section Final)
Scotland
Third
Gems from Maritana
Adam Smith Theatre, Kirkcaldy, Fife, Scotland, UK 11 bands played.
Original decision hotly disputed (contest was held on 27/11/1920 in St Margaret's Hall Dunfermline, winners Lassodie, Balgonie and Leven); contest re-held. 2nd decision shown.
Newspaper report in the Sunday Post 26/12/1920, gives Rosyth as 4th place, and the conductor of Bowhill as J.B. Huggins, and that of Balgonie as John Haldane
Oct. 4, 2011, 10:16 a.m. Aug. 7, 2013, 10:43 a.m.
1 Bowhill Colliery and District Silver Band F. Johnston
2 Shotts St Patrick's Brass John Faulds
3 Balgonie Colliery George Hawkins
4 Lassodie Public Friend Farrand
5 Blackbraes G.V. Huggins
5 Wellesley Colliery Band Robert Rimmer
Unknown Result Dysart Colliery Silver Band Unknown
Unknown Result Leven Town Unknown
Unknown Result Rosyth G. B. Forrester
